intro: Rubus arabicus, commonly known as the Arabian bramble, is a species of flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the Rosaceae family, which includes roses, strawberries, and other shrubs. The plant is characterized by its thorny stems, trifoliate leaves, and small, aggregate fruits that develop from its flowers. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and limited water availability. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in landscaping in regions with similar climatic conditions.
